description: Borrowed from Hokkien 人參／人参 (jîn-som).

entries.meaning: Any plant of two species of the genus Panax (Panax ginseng and Panax quinquefolius), having forked roots supposed to have medicinal properties.
The root of such a plant, or an extract of these roots.
examples: When the Afghan princes find it necessary to employ Chob-Chini, (the Jin-seng, or China root so celebrated as a purifier, tonic, and aphrodisiac) they choose the spring season.
